Headline: Top European destinations for January 2020
Article_Body: Florence, Italy: A rare snow makes one of the world's loveliest cities that much prettier. But usually a visitor here will find only chilly temperatures -- so bundle up and enjoy Florence sans the rest of humanity. Click through the gallery for more top destinations to visit in Europe in January: Florence, Italy: If it's too chilly for a proper stroll, head indoors to the city's incredible museums. At the Uffizi Gallery, visitors admire early Renaissance painter Sandro Botticelli's "Spring." But check it out in January and you might not have to share the moment with so many others. Tromso, Norway: There's nothing like the melancholy  beauty of a deep winter blue -- this is a general view of Tromso on January 19, 2019, during its long polar night. For those open to winter travel, the splendors of this northern Norwegian outpost are many. Tromso, Norway: This is the biggest reason most people come here in depths of winter -- the potential opportunity to eye witness the spectacle of the northern lights.  Monte Carlo, Monaco: If speed is what you need, head to this city of mountainous twists and turns for the annual Ralley Monte-Carlo. Monte Carlo, Monaco: If luxury is what you need, consider a stay at the Hôtel de Paris Monte-Carlo. It underwent a dramatic renovation in 2019, and it was Princess Grace's favorite hotel. Gstaad, Switzerland: This village in the German-speaking section of the Canton of Bern in southwestern Switzerland is a celeb favorite. But it's welcoming to everyone. Gstaad, Switzerland: Take in some outdoor art such as the mirror-clad installation "Mirage Gstaad" by American artist Doug Aitken. But don't dawdle -- it will be taken down in January 2021. Canary Islands: This is your warm-weather play for Europe in January, with villages such as San Andres beckoning you to enjoy some sunshine and escape from bone-deep cold. Canary Islands: Men ride their horses at La Enramada Beach on the island of Tenerife,on January 20, 2019. The annual ride celebrates Saint Sebastian, considered the patron protector of animals against pests and disease.
